verses.kjv: Now it came to pass, when Sanballat, and Tobiah, and Geshem the Arabian, and the rest of our enemies, heard that I had builded the wall, and that there was no breach left therein; (though at that time I had not set up the doors upon the gates;)
verses.ct: When Sanballat, Tobiah, Geshem the Arabian, and the rest of our enemies found out that I had rebuilt the wall and that no gaps remained in it — though I hadn't yet installed the doors in the gates —

verses.kjv: That Sanballat and Geshem sent unto me, saying, Come, let us meet together in some one of the villages in the plain of Ono. But they thought to do me mischief.
verses.ct: Sanballat and Geshem sent me a message saying, 'Come, let's meet together in one of the villages on the plain of Ono.' But they were planning to harm me.

verses.kjv: And I sent messengers unto them, saying, I am doing a great work, so that I cannot come down: why should the work cease, whilst I leave it, and come down to you?
verses.ct: So I sent messengers back to them with this reply: 'I'm involved in an important project and can't come down. Why should the work stop just so I can leave it and come meet with you?'

verses.kjv: Yet they sent unto me four times after this sort; and I answered them after the same manner.
verses.ct: They sent me the same kind of message 4 times, and each time I gave them the same answer.

verses.kjv: Then sent Sanballat his servant unto me in like manner the fifth time with an open letter in his hand;
verses.ct: Then Sanballat sent his servant to me a 5th time, carrying an unsealed letter.

verses.kjv: Wherein was written, It is reported among the heathen, and Gashmu saith it, that thou and the Jews think to rebel: for which cause thou buildest the wall, that thou mayest be their king, according to these words.
verses.ct: It read: 'There is a rumor circulating among the surrounding nations — and Gashmu confirms it — that you and the Jews are planning a revolt. That's supposedly why you're rebuilding the wall, so that you can make yourself their king.

verses.kjv: And thou hast also appointed prophets to preach of thee at Jerusalem, saying, There is a king in Judah: and now shall it be reported to the king according to these words. Come now therefore, and let us take counsel together.
verses.ct: You've also supposedly appointed prophets to announce in Jerusalem, "There is a king in Judah!" This report is going to reach the Persian king. So come, let's discuss this together.'

verses.kjv: Then I sent unto him, saying, There are no such things done as thou sayest, but thou feignest them out of thine own heart.
verses.ct: I sent him this reply: 'Nothing you're describing is actually happening. You're inventing all of this yourself.'

verses.kjv: For they all made us afraid, saying, Their hands shall be weakened from the work, that it be not done. Now therefore, O God, strengthen my hands.
verses.ct: They were all trying to intimidate us, thinking, 'They'll lose their motivation and the work will never get finished.' So I prayed, 'God, give me strength.'

verses.kjv: Afterward I came unto the house of Shemaiah the son of Delaiah the son of Mehetabeel, who was shut up; and he said, Let us meet together in the house of God, within the temple, and let us shut the doors of the temple: for they will come to slay thee; yea, in the night will they come to slay thee.
verses.ct: Later I went to the house of Shemaiah son of Delaiah, son of Mehetabeel, who had confined himself at home. He said, 'Let's go together into the house of God, inside the temple, and lock the temple doors behind us, because men are coming to kill you — they're coming to kill you tonight.'

verses.kjv: And I said, Should such a man as I flee? and who is there, that, being as I am, would go into the temple to save his life? I will not go in.
verses.ct: But I responded, 'Should someone in my position run away? And what man like me would hide in the temple just to save his own life? I won't do it.'

verses.kjv: And, lo, I perceived that God had not sent him; but that he pronounced this prophecy against me: for Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.
verses.ct: I realized that God had not sent him. He had delivered this so-called prophecy against me because Tobiah and Sanballat had paid him off.

verses.kjv: Therefore was he hired, that I should be afraid, and do so, and sin, and that they might have matter for an evil report, that they might reproach me.
verses.ct: He was hired so that I would be frightened into doing what he said, which would have been a sin. Then they would have had something to use against my reputation and discredit me.

verses.kjv: My God, think thou upon Tobiah and Sanballat according to these their works, and on the prophetess Noadiah, and the rest of the prophets, that would have put me in fear.
verses.ct: My God, remember what Tobiah and Sanballat have done, and also the prophetess Noadiah and the other prophets who tried to intimidate me.

verses.kjv: So the wall was finished in the twenty and fifth day of the month Elul, in fifty and two days.
verses.ct: The wall was completed on the 25th day of the month of Elul, after just 52 days of work.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when all our enemies heard thereof, and all the heathen that were about us saw these things, they were much cast down in their own eyes: for they perceived that this work was wrought of our God.
verses.ct: When all our enemies heard about it, and all the surrounding nations saw it, they were completely demoralized. They recognized that this project had been accomplished with the help of our God.

verses.kjv: Moreover in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters unto Tobiah, and the letters of Tobiah came unto them.
verses.ct: During that time, the nobles of Judah were constantly exchanging letters with Tobiah.

verses.kjv: For there were many in Judah sworn unto him, because he was the son in law of Shechaniah the son of Arah; and his son Johanan had taken the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah.
verses.ct: Many people in Judah were bound to him by oath, since he was the son-in-law of Shechaniah son of Arah, and his son Johanan had married the daughter of Meshullam son of Berechiah.

verses.kjv: Also they reported his good deeds before me, and uttered my words to him. And Tobiah sent letters to put me in fear.
verses.ct: They kept telling me about Tobiah's good qualities, and they reported back to him everything I said. Meanwhile, Tobiah kept sending letters trying to intimidate me.
